I'm in the midst of doing some housekeeping so these pages are pretty bare - all the information you need for the themes should be available though. :)

Oulipo v. 1.0.9.2 for WordPress

  • License: GPL v3
  • Download: Download from wordpress.org
  • Demo: Demo
  • Fork me on github
  • Support, comments, requests over at GetSatisfaction

Inspired by and named after the group Oulipo, this clean, minimal, grid-based theme was created for authors who want their content to shine. Three-column simplicity with an eye for typography, Oulipo is also available on WordPress.com

Features

  1. Custom menu support
  2. Custom background and headers
  3. Post thumbnails
  4. A widget-enabled sidebar
  5. Front page styling for sticky posts
  6. Threaded comments for WordPress 2.7+

Changelog

October 18th, 2010

  • Version 1.0.9.2
  • Language attributes in html tag made dynamic
  • XFN profile link added
  • Max-width set on images to match up with width of the content column

October 12th, 2010

  • Version 1.0.9.1
  • Relative sizes of headers and lists (ordered and unordered) made consistent
  • Widgetized sidebar applied globally
  • Custom header preview area modified to mirror site display
  • Credit link and license URI updated to satisfy WordPress theme requirements
  • Permalink added to metadata below title

September 21st, 2010

  • Version 1.0.9
  • Fixed em display issue on archive pages
  • Character encoding fixed
  • Search button display issue fixed

September 13th, 2010

  • Version 1.0.8
  • Compatibility changes for WordPress.org acceptance (mostly a change in how things like the search form and comment form are called)
  • Additional style changes for comment forms and for the WordPress unit tests

August 14th, 2010

  • Version 1.0.7
  • Added custom menu support
  • Added support for custom background and header
  • Added support for post thumbnails
  • Cleaned up the css, link colors, and layout
  • Removed black border around post images
  • Added display for search results
  • Changed the look of input and textarea boxes

June 6th, 2009

  • Version 1.0.6
  • Fixed emoticon display – emoticons now display inline without a border

May 5th, 2009

  • Version 1.0.5
  • Widgets enabled on page displays

March 23rd, 2009

  • Version 1.0.4
  • Title pages revamped to reflect site name
  • Paginated posts now supported (thank you Spider)
  • Issue with multiple left float images causing comments and ‘read more’ links to creep into the post area fixed
  • Comment support on Pages added

January 16th, 2009

  • Version 1.0.3
  • Styling for text-widget added to follow the design guide for Oulipo
  • Hard coded ‘About’ text in the sidebar commented out

January 9th, 2009

  • Version 1.0.2
  • Additional styles as specified by the WordPress theme directory
  • Modified page listing for the main navigation – main navigation will no longer display sub-pages

January 3rd, 2009

  • Version 1.0 released

If you use and enjoy Oulipo, please consider donating via PayPal or sending a book from my wish list.

Oulipo v.1.0.9.2 / Last updated October 18th, 2010 / WordPress

Inspired by and named after the group Oulipo, this clean, minimal, grid-based theme was created for authors who want their content to shine. Three-column simplicity with an eye for typography, Oulipo is also available on WordPress.com

Info / Download

Zack 990 v.1.2 / Last updated May 16th, 2010 / WordPress

Based on the Boston Globe's The Big Picture, this theme puts photos and videos up front at 990 pixels wide. Zack 990 is not meant for written content alone, so if your weapon is words then you might want to check out Oulipo.

Info / Download

Got a question? Community feedback, questions, and answers are collected over at Get Satisfaction. If you use and enjoy these themes, consider donating via PayPal or sending a book from my wish list (Kindle editions happily welcome). Ocular Professor and Wakalixes are no longer in active development.
